title: Error: We're unable to log you in because you may be offline. (Everything tried)
body:
I've been having problem in the login screen where it will display the message "We're unable to log you in because you may be offline".
I have tried everything including deleting the line in the LeagueClientSettings,  and deleting the line in the hosts file in the system32 folder.
I have reset my internet countless times, and have reset my PC countless times. I'll be able to log in once a blue moon, but whenever I log out, the error persist for an unknown amount of times. I have not seen any other fixes besides the previous two named, and to be frank, I am getting extremely frustrated coming home and not being able to play.

replies.body: Sorry you've been dealing with this, though I appreciate all the steps you've tried.  Cases like this are usually network issues or blocks getting in the way, so adjusting game files won't do too much here.  Are you on wireless?  Let's start out with a[ port forward](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq8) to help make sure your network is clear of any blocks.  To add to that, if you have any antivirus enabled double check to make sure it's not getting in the way.
I am on a wired connection. I have done the port forward, and after doing it I still receive the error. I do not have any antivirus that is blocking the network.

Gotcha, thanks for trying!  In that case grab some logs from our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team will be able to take a deeper look with you and find more options.  See ya there!

After doing the port forward, I failed to restart my router. Having restarted my router, the client works fine! Thanks for linking the port forward video as I would have been hopeless without it. Thanks!
Woohoo!  Glad to hear everything is okay now!
Both me and my brother are experiencing this, and we are both wired. I am convinced it is a networking issue so any solution is welcomed.
